item.title: FCC says all smartphones must be hearing aid-compatible
item.description:
The Federal Communications Commission announced that, going forward, all mobile handsets in the US including smartphones will have to be compatible with hearing aids. Itâ€™s also established new rules around volume control and improved product labeling so people with hearing aids can make informed buying decisions.

The gist is that the FCC is establishing a Bluetooth pairing requirement, thereby discouraging smartphone makers from using proprietary versions that could limit compatibility. In a press release, it says that doing so will ensure universal connectivity between mobile phones, hearing aids, and over-the-counter hearing aids.
